samples.question: So first of all, do you think we should tell the truth at all times?
samples.transcript: Well, generally speaking, it is advisable to tell the truth whenever you can because the consequences of lines that lines bring about can be detrimental. But it not always the case I mean you can also tell lines when you don want to hurt other people feelings For example when a girl wants to break up with her boyfriend she may come up with thousands excuses like she doesn have the time for the relationship or that she want to focus on her future But in fact, what is going on is that she has a change of heart, but she just does not want to break the boy's heart.

But it not always the case Um I mean you can also tell lines when you don want to hurt other people feelings For example when a girl wants to break up with her boyfriend she may come up with thousands excuses like she doesn have the time for the relationship or that she want to focus on her future But in fact, what is going on is that she has a change of heart, but she just doesn't want to break the boy's heart.

samples.question: How do you know when others are telling lies?
samples.transcript: I guess there is a variety of ways, in which we can spot if the person is telling the truth or not. And one of which is to listen to their tone of voice. Because we have a tendency to speak in higher pitch when we are telling lines. so we may detect a person, by their tone of voice. And another way is to maybe look at their facial expressions. I mean if the person is not an actor or actress, you may always see a, like, small changes in nuance of expressions. And that tells, that proves that the person is not being honest.
samples.transcript_original: I guess there's a variety of ways, uh, in which we can spot if the person is telling the truth or not. And one of which is to listen to their tone of voice. Because we have a tendency to speak in higher pitch when we're telling lines. Uh, so we may detect a person, uh, by their tone of voice. And another way is to maybe look at their facial expressions. I mean if the person is not an actor or actress, uh, you may always see a, like, small changes in nuance of expressions. And that tells, that proves that the person is not being honest.

I mean if the person is not an actor or actress, you may always see a, like, small changes in nuance of expressions. And that tells, that proves that the person is not being honest.

samples.question: And why is it easier to tell the truth to strangers than to friends or family?
samples.transcript: Well, to my mind, this can be attributed to a few reasons, but the most obvious one is that it would be less embarrassing to tell strangers the truth, especially your problems. I mean, we always want to create an image of that independent individual with strong mentality who can always manage things on our own. So, sometimes we may think that telling our, the ones closest to us, that we are in trouble is a sign of weakness. And yeah, that is one reason I can think of right now. Thank you.

So, uh, sometimes we may think that telling our, the ones closest to us, um, that we're in trouble is a sign of weakness. And yeah, that is one reason I can think of right now. Thank you.

samples.question: And what do you think of communicating via social media?

samples.question: Do you think online communication through social media will replace face-to-face communication?
samples.transcript: Personally I do not think so cause of course we can we can make communication through like social media but still it is it is bit different like I do not think I do not think we can make like deeper, deeper conversation through online. usually I, I like, I share like my deeper, like my life or like that kind of things are like usually face to face and like I just do simple, simple conversations through online like social media so I do not think it can replace a face to face conversation. samples.question: Okay, and first of all, could you tell me are you working or are you a student?
samples.transcript: I am working now as a dancer and performer since I major dance and I mostly work as a freelancer in South Korea but I start my new season abroad on this January.
samples.transcript_original: I'm working now as a dancer and performer since I major dance and I mostly work as a freelancer in South Korea but I start my new season abroad on this January.

samples.question: Okay, and do you like Your job?
samples.transcript: Yes, I love it. it is my favorite thing in the world.
samples.transcript_original: Yes, I love it. It's my favorite thing in the world.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Yes, I love it. it is my favorite thing in the world.

samples.question: What do you like most about your job?
samples.transcript: To perform, travel, and get paid. Now we are going to talk about writing.
samples.transcript_original: Um, to perform, travel, and get paid. Now we're gonna talk about writing.
samples.transcript_cleaned: To perform, travel, and get paid. Now we are going to talk about writing.

samples.question: So do you write a lot?
samples.transcript: Yes, I, when I was young I tried to write my diary every day to record my practice, like it was kind of practice note. But these days I do not really write every day, but when I want to write, I think I write. Yeah.
samples.transcript_original: Yes, I, um, when I was young I tried to write my diary every day to record my practice, like it was kind of practice note. But these days I don't really write every day, but when I want to write, I think I write. Yeah.

samples.question: And what do you like to write?
samples.transcript: About my feelings usually, and also if there are something like special, some occasions or some certain thing happened, then I write about that, but usually about my feelings.
samples.transcript_original: About my feelings usually, and also if there are something like special, um, some occasions or some certain thing happened, then I write about that, but usually about my feelings.

samples.question: And do you think the things you like to write will change in the future?
samples.transcript: I do not know. I think about the feelings I am going to write like maybe forever because that is my like, the main topic of my diary. But maybe some other exceptional subjects or external subjects will be changed of course because I am going to be changed. okay.

samples.question: And do you prefer writing by hand or typing on a computer?
samples.transcript: Usually by hand because I like the feelings of the pen and pencils. But if I do not have the note or paper, then I like to write with my phone by typing. alright. And now we are going to talk about puzzles.

samples.question: So, did you do puzzles in your childhood?
samples.transcript: Maybe, but I do not really remember. I think there was a one, maybe only one puzzle in my room and it was like a princess like puzzle. So all the princess characters were there and I was just puzzling. But except that I do not really remember other puzzles. Okay.
